channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: COVID-19 case tally in Philippines hits 47,873 with 1,540 new infections
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The Philippines has been seeing a renewed spike in COVID-19 infections after the country further eased community quarantine measures nationwide.

item.title: SC orders government: Answer legal challenges vs anti-terrorism law
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: The four petitions, filed by lawmakers and law experts, also asked for the issuance of a temporary halt order against the implementation of the law which would take effect, according to the Malacañang, on July 18.

item.title: Is the coronavirus airborne? DOH says there's ‘not enough’ proof
item.description: The World Health Organization has long maintained that SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes coronavirus disease (COVID019), spreads primarily through small droplets generated when an infected person coughs or sneezes.

item.title: Non-essential trips, tourism abroad now allowed — Palace
item.description: "We cannot afford a second wave...as much as possible, the economy should stay open. I still believe we are still winning the fight vs COVID-19," Roque said.

item.title: CHR to investigate killing of teen who accused Ilocos Sur cops of rape
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: "We hold on to our police force’s commitment to 'serve and protect' our rights and, if needed, ensure accountability for the indignities committed even if the perpetrators are among their ranks," De Guia said.

item.title: Zarate: Congress has duty to uphold press freedom, no power to dictate news content
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Rep. Carlos Zarate (Bayan Muna party-list) said that the lawmakers’ role is to ensure that the members of the press “are free to do their jobs in reporting or scrutinizing what is happening in our society, that there is no killing or suppressing of their freedom to report.”

item.title: Climate activist Greta Thunberg joins calls to junk anti-terrorism law
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The fear that environmental workers may be mistaken for terrorists or rebels is not unfounded.

item.title: COVID-19 cases may breach 65,000 by end of July, 100,000 by end of August — UP researcher
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: While researchers predict an increase of around 25,000 COVID-19 infections from June to July, they now predict an increase of over 35,000 from July to August.

item.title: Framers of Constitution oppose anti-terrorism law
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: “This law precisely creates a climate of fear, sends a chilling effect, on those who wish to express their legitimate grievances, state their aspirations, and wish to engage in open and democratic debate, and threatens the rights of associations who may wish to dissent and question the actuations of those in power."

item.title: DOH apologizes for mistakenly identifying emerging COVID-19 hotspots in Metro Manila
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The Department of Health issued an apology Monday night hours after it mistakenly announced that four cities in Metro Manila had been classified as emerging virus hotspots.
